metadata.name: Water Boiling Example
metadata.description: Simple example demonstrating hypergraph entailment structure

claims.text: Liquid water can be heated to 100°C using available heat sources
claims.reasoning: Common heat sources (stove, hot plate, etc.) can easily reach >100°C

claims.text: At standard pressure, water has a boiling point of 100°C
When liquid water reaches its boiling point, it transitions to gas phase
claims.reasoning: Definition of boiling point - phase transition temperature

claims.text: I can raise the temperature of liquid water to 100°C AND it will turn into a gas phase
claims.reasoning: Follows from c1, c2, c3 via modus ponens

implications.reasoning: If I can heat water to 100°C (c1), and 100°C is the boiling point (c2), and water transitions to gas at boiling point (c3), then heating water to 100°C will cause it to become gas (c4)
